posts.name: George
posts.cooked:
With all these new narrow swerve modules dropping, I wanted to share my own custom narrow swerve design. My custom swerve design journey started in 2022 on CD , but this is actually the first time I’ve posted one of my swerve modules here.

So, here’s the Z.6N:

Z.6N-8 3296×2547 1.27 MB

Z.6N-8 3296×2547 1.27 MB

Z.6N-8 3296×2547 1.27 MB

Here’s an example of it on a small drivetrain:

Assembly 1-75 3296×2547 1.47 MB

Assembly 1-75 3296×2547 1.47 MB

Assembly 1-75 3296×2547 1.47 MB

Goals/requirements:

Tiny footprint

Narrow Module

On-axis encoder

Ease of assembly

Low ground clearance

Variety of drive motor and on-axis encoder options

Top or bottom tube mount options using same support plate

Taps on top plates for nut strips/mechanism mounting

Looks sick asf

Manufacturability was something I really valued in my past swerve designs, but I decided this time to just go all out and see how far I could push the design of a narrow swerve. So we end up with a 4.5x6.5” footprint and 1.25” ground clearance. I think its quite elegant and pretty cool looking too

~ 345 steer RPM

~ 17.6 ft/s

Compared with Mk5n, SwerveX2st, and my own previous Z.4N:

Assembly 1-76 3296×2547 1.47 MB

Assembly 1-76 3296×2547 1.47 MB

Assembly 1-76 3296×2547 1.47 MB

While it only has a 3.5x1.75” wheel and uses a Minion on steer, I really like the packaging it allows for. It’s the smallest inverted swerve I’ve seen in FRC (especially for the wheel size).

Some more pics:

Z.6N-9 3296×2547 1.27 MB

Z.6N-9 3296×2547 1.27 MB

Z.6N-9 3296×2547 1.27 MB

Z.6N-10 3296×2547 2.6 MB

Z.6N-10 3296×2547 2.6 MB

Z.6N-10 3296×2547 2.6 MB

Z.6N-11 3296×2547 3.64 MB

Z.6N-11 3296×2547 3.64 MB

Z.6N-11 3296×2547 3.64 MB
